intro: Heliosperma pusillum subsp. moehringiifolium, commonly known as the Moehring's heliosperma, is a small, herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
